inclusion.criterion: Participants were informed informally via telephone first, and then invited to the Clinic by a Patient Invitation Letter.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A structured one-to-one information session was carried out with each participant at the Clinic, during which they were given a Participant Information Sheet.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Participants provided written informed consent by signing the a Participant Consent Form.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Total sample size was 44, consisting of two 22-subject groups (control and intervention group).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A targeted sample size of 36 subjects (18 per arm) was expected to provide at least 80% power to detect a difference of 5% or above in primary outcome non-HDL-C and LDL-C III particle concentration when compared with placebo (α=0.05).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Sample size was assigned as 44 to allow for subject attrition and other potential causes of study withdrawal up to 20%.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The power calculation was based on the mean changes in non-HDL-C measurement of the previous COMBOS trial which is a largest randomized placebo controlled trial that has the same design with this study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: A randomized, double-blind, placebo controlled, parallel groups study was carried out.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Before entry into the intervention phase of the study, 8-weeks of dietary lead-in was carried out.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Study participants received dietary counselling for the 8 weeks before the intervention, based on the heart-healthy diet structured in the United Kingdom (UK) National Institute of Health Care Excellence (NICE) guidelines (2014).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Adherence to dietary advice was also measured by a 3-day weighed intake food diary at Week 4.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Recent history of certain heart, kidney, liver, or cancer: Patients that have had any type of heart surgery, Patients that are diagnosed with any type of cancer and/or have had any kind of cancer therapy, Patients that have had kidney failure, Patients that have had liver failure, in the past 6 months
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient is a 32-year-old obese woman who came to the clinic with weight concerns. She is complaining of sleep apnea, PCO and dissatisfaction with her body shape.
